titleStmt.title: J. H. Schollek et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8684

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: J F Robinson Governor of Kentucky.

Your Petitioners would State that at the September Term 1861 of the Powell Circuit Court a Judgement for $20.00 and Costs was rendered in said court in favor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky against John F Holly for the offense of gaming. Mr Holly is a citizen of Stanton Powell Co. Ky. a clever man and a good Citizen, We would further State that he is a poor man with a helpless family to support. Considering these hard times, especially in the mountains where the necessaries of life are Scarce and command almost fabulous prices we feel ^assured^ that your Excellencys clemency in his behalf ^at this time^ will be duly appreciated by this Community. Mr Holly is a loyal man to his government his attention and liberality in feeding union Soldiers fully attest this fact

J H Schollek Cir Ct
Jes B Hardwick J P C C
C D Creed C.P.C
M Steward
Geo. M, Pettit P. M.
Johnson A. Lawson D S
Thos C. Judy C P C C

Powell Cir Ct
Fine Remitted
J F Robinson
$20. } Gaming
John F. Holly
Issd Feby 3. 1863
